issues.issue_name: GSTR-3B vs GSTR-1 Outward Supply Mismatch

templates.brief_facts: For the period {{period}}, the outward taxable supply declared in GSTR-1 amounts to ₹{{gstr1_taxable}}, whereas the outward taxable supply declared in GSTR-3B amounts to ₹{{gstr3b_taxable}}. This results in a difference of ₹{{value_difference}}. The corresponding tax difference amounts to ₹{{tax_difference}}.
templates.grounds: The taxpayer is required to report outward supplies consistently in both GSTR-1 and GSTR-3B. The detected mismatch indicates short declaration of outward taxable supplies in GSTR-3B, resulting in short payment of tax.
templates.legal: Section 59 of the CGST Act mandates self-assessment of tax, while Section 75(12) provides that tax declared in returns must be paid. Any underreported liability in GSTR-3B compared to GSTR-1 is recoverable as self-assessed tax.
templates.conclusion: In view of the above facts and legal provisions, differential tax of ₹{{tax_difference}} along with applicable interest is payable. The taxpayer is required to furnish justification or discharge the liability accordingly.

table.title: Outward Supply Comparison – GSTR-1 vs GSTR-3B

issues.calc_logic:
def compute(v):
    g1 = float(v.get('gstr1_taxable', 0))
    g3 = float(v.get('gstr3b_taxable', 0))
    rate = float(v.get('tax_rate', 18))

    value_diff = round(g1 - g3, 2)
    tax_diff = round(value_diff * (rate / 100), 2) if value_diff > 0 else 0
    
    # Standardized keys for auto-calculation
    return {
        'value_difference': value_diff,
        'tax_difference': tax_diff,
        'calculated_tax': tax_diff,
        'calculated_interest': 0,
        'calculated_penalty': 0
    }
